greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The smallest prime whose square divides the first nonsquarefree number on row n of Pascal's triangle, 1 if all terms on that row are squarefree.
comment: All such n, for which a(n) < 3, form a subsequence of A249724.
xref: Differs from A249718 for the first time at n=36, where a(36) = 2, while A249718(36) = 3.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 04 2014
